Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2013 01:40AM TxAgSueB wrote: Hi Rambo50 -  a friend of mine who had cancer/chemo a number of years ago told me that she used Mighty Mouth when she had mouth sores.  Yes, it's for after the fact, but she said it really helped her.  She thought it had lydacain(sp?) in it.   I am using Biotene mouthwash starting today to keep my mouth moist.  But a co-worker (going thru chemo now) has been using a baking soda/water/salt rinse 5 --6 times per day.  She is on chemo treatment #7 of 8, and she has had NO mouth sores.  She is getting Taxotere and Cytoxan now, which is what I will be starting tomorrow. I hope this helps!!! BTHO BC!!! Sue
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2013 Mellie289 JeriGrace

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2013 03:06PM TxAgSueB wrote: Hi franky and option-- I have read the vitamin K2 helps your body absorb D3. honeybunny96 - i encourage you to start taking D3.  The brand that was recommended to me is Carlson.  I have heard Usana is great, but you have to buy from a distributor. Gma04 - I pray you feel better soon! ~Sue
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2013 Mellie289 JeriGrace

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2013 09:36AM TxAgSueB wrote: Hello all, I will start my chemo (TC x 4 ) on July 11th. I am praying for minimal side effects!  I plan to work as much as possible ( 3 kids in college and a wedding next summer!) but can take off when needed. 2 questions:   1.  Has anyone read/used "The cancer fighting kitchen" by Rebecca Katz? 2.  Vitamin D - I am reading more and more about Vitamin D levels and how sufficient levels help fight off cancer.  My Vitamin D level was tested in March and was low (15).  Normal levels are 40--60.  Anyone else know if you are low Vitamin D? I am praying for the best possible outcomes for all of my sisters starting chemo in July.  I plan to BTHO BC (Beat the Hell Outa Breast Cancer) and I expect you all to do the same!!! BTHO BC!! Sue
